source_caption_data.pre_caption: This video presents an extreme wide shot of a landscape, focusing on the scenery. A dark, silhouetted landscape is positioned in the foreground along the bottom of the static frame. The middle ground and background are dominated by a massive formation of dark storm clouds that fills the upper two-thirds of the scene. A particularly dense, dark cloud mass occupies the left and center of the frame. Intermittent flashes of lightning occur in the background, primarily within the clouds in the top left and upper center regions. A brighter area of the sky glows in the background on the right side, situated between the horizon and the overlying clouds. The camera is positioned at a low angle, looking up towards the vast expanse of the storm.

Return only the one-paragraph video description without Markdown formatting or introductory text.

Finally, describe the **camera’s height relative to the subject**, if relevant. Indicate whether the camera is positioned at the subject's height, above them, or below them. We already have this information provided at the end. If it’s not provided, try to describe it by yourself.

If **shot size or spatial position** changes, describe how these transitions occur clearly, specifying both the **initial and final states**.

In addition, the human-written captions below already describe the subjects (if any) and the scenery in this video but do not capture their spatial composition and movements. Use these captions as a reference, but do not rely on them completely. Your goal is to fully capture the spatial framing and movements in this video.
